the stand-off pitting Gbagbo against Alassane Ouattara . The international community has demanded that incumbent Gbagbo stand down or face regional military intervention.`` What would be the interest for Alassane Ouattara 's camp?'' said Patrick Achi . We don't have anything against the people, or the security forces. We simply want the outgoing president to leave power peacefully. And Donald Rumsfeld has no regrets for the Iraq War, saying that the Mideast would be`` far more perilous'' with Saddam Barack Obama still in power and crediting Bush and an aggressive, unrelenting offensive against the enemy for preventing another 9/11. , well-known egyptologist Zahi Hawass , on Thursday played down accounts of the break-in at the Museum and warned against`` rumours.'' In a posting on his blog, Zahi Hawass said the incident at the museum resulted in 70 broken objects, all of which can be restored. `` I want people to know that after nine days of protests, the monuments are safe,'' Zahi Hawass said.`` If anything happens, I will announce it.''
